tldr: The authors studied small daytime changes in the virtual height of ionosphere reflexions with periods of 10 minutes to 1 hour. They discovered that these changes can be explained by reflexions from a curved surface associated with travelling disturbances. The research also showed that these disturbances are present most of the time during the day, affecting the ionosphere's virtual height and causing different types of complexity in the reflexions.
